title: How to Get Bombs in the Legend of Zelda

steps.headline: Save some Rupees.
steps.description: Kill weak enemies, break jars, open treasure chests, or cut bushes to get Rupees. Save up to at least 30 Rupees to buy bombs.

steps.headline: Go to a town shop.
steps.description: Each town on every version of the game has its own town shop where you can buy supplies, like potions, arrows, and of course, bombs.

steps.headline: Buy some bombs.
steps.description: You can buy bombs for 30 Rupees for every 10 pieces, and these can be bought over and over once your supplies run out (applies on every version of Legend of Zelda). Simply approach the merchant of any store and talk to him or her to purchase a bomb.

steps.headline: Kill enemies.
steps.description: If you don’t have the money to buy bombs, you can still get some for free. Try killing weak enemies, like Oktoroks or Moblins. These monsters will randomly drop bombs. Bombs, along with Rupees and arrows, are the most commonly dropped items by weak enemies.

steps.headline: Open treasure chests.
steps.description: Another way to get free bombs is by opening the treasure chests you’ll find inside dungeons. Treasure chest items are randomly placed inside, but there’s a higher chance that you’ll get bombs instead of other items, like arrows.

steps.headline: Break jars.
steps.description: Legend of Zelda is well known for putting a lot jars all throughout the gaming world of every version. These jars can be broken into pieces and drop random items, like bombs. Just like with killing low-level monsters, bombs are one of the items that are commonly dropped when you break jars.
